title: How to Cancel an Order

steps.headline: Find your receipt from the order.
steps.description: If you made the order by phone, you may have written down a confirmation code in place of the receipt.

steps.headline: Call the company’s customer service hotline.
steps.description: Find it on the receipt or on the “Contact Us” section of their website.

steps.headline: Look for the customer service number using an online tool, like GetHuman.
steps.description: They list all major retailers and provide numbers for them. You can also use their calling service to call the company.

steps.headline: Dial the number from a touch-tone phone.
steps.description: Use the numbers or the voice menus to go to the order cancellation section, or simply the order section of the menu.

steps.headline: Follow the prompts to reach a customer service representative.
steps.description: Tell them your confirmation code and any other pertinent information. If the prompts don’t lead you to an order information section, dial zero to be put on the line with an operator or customer service representative more quickly.

steps.headline: Listen for instructions about whether the order can be cancelled.
steps.description: If the order has already shipped, the customer service rep will tell you to refuse the package at the door or to return it using their returns process.

steps.headline: Ask for a confirmation code if your cancellation is accepted.
steps.description: Write it somewhere where you will remember to look later.

steps.headline: Watch your credit card or bank account to see signs of the funds being returned.
steps.description: If they don’t return your purchase price within one month, contact the customer service number with your confirmation code to insist on a refund.

steps.headline: Sign into your online account on the website where you ordered the item.
steps.description: Try to do this as soon as possible, since online shipments usually go out fast. If the item has already shipped, you may not be able to cancel it.

steps.headline: Go to the “My Orders” section of the website once you’ve signed in.
steps.description: Find the order that you want to cancel in the list of orders.

steps.headline: Look for a “Cancel Order” link or button.
steps.description: Press it. If there isn’t a button that says this, look for customer service contact information. Some companies prefer that you cancel orders by phone or through email.

steps.headline: Fill out any information regarding why you want to cancel the order.
steps.description: Submit your cancellation. Alternatively, use the email address provided to cancel the order. If you are submitting a cancellation request by email, make sure to include your name, the order date, the order number, an account number, your address, item descriptions and the reason for your return in your email.

steps.headline: Wait to hear back about your cancellation on your account or by email.
steps.description: If you don’t hear anything within one or two business days, it is a good idea to call a customer service number to ensure your request has been received.

steps.headline: Find the receipt or confirmation code for your purchase.
Go to the nearest location where you want to cancel an order.
steps.description: This method is often used when you have selected a “ship to store” option.

steps.headline: Find the Customer Service help desk.
steps.description: Give the representative your order number and receipt and tell them you want to cancel.

steps.headline: Give them your credit card to credit the purchase.
Opt to return the item if it has already shipped and they won’t accept the cancellation.
steps.description: You may be required to pay shipping to all delivered items.

steps.headline: Get a cancellation number or a new receipt to confirm you have cancelled successfully.

text: Canceling By Phone Find your receipt from the order. If you made the order by phone, you may have written down a confirmation code in place of the receipt. Call the company’s customer service hotline. Find it on the receipt or on the “Contact Us” section of their website. Look for the customer service number using an online tool, like GetHuman. They list all major retailers and provide numbers for them. You can also use their calling service to call the company. Dial the number from a touch-tone phone. Use the numbers or the voice menus to go to the order cancellation section, or simply the order section of the menu. Follow the prompts to reach a customer service representative. Tell them your confirmation code and any other pertinent information. If the prompts don’t lead you to an order information section, dial zero to be put on the line with an operator or customer service representative more quickly. Listen for instructions about whether the order can be cancelled. If the order has already shipped, the customer service rep will tell you to refuse the package at the door or to return it using their returns process. Ask for a confirmation code if your cancellation is accepted. Write it somewhere where you will remember to look later. Watch your credit card or bank account to see signs of the funds being returned. If they don’t return your purchase price within one month, contact the customer service number with your confirmation code to insist on a refund. Canceling Online Sign into your online account on the website where you ordered the item. Try to do this as soon as possible, since online shipments usually go out fast. If the item has already shipped, you may not be able to cancel it. Go to the “My Orders” section of the website once you’ve signed in. Find the order that you want to cancel in the list of orders. Look for a “Cancel Order” link or button. Press it. If there isn’t a button that says this, look for customer service contact information. Some companies prefer that you cancel orders by phone or through email. Fill out any information regarding why you want to cancel the order. Submit your cancellation. Alternatively, use the email address provided to cancel the order. If you are submitting a cancellation request by email, make sure to include your name, the order date, the order number, an account number, your address, item descriptions and the reason for your return in your email. Wait to hear back about your cancellation on your account or by email. If you don’t hear anything within one or two business days, it is a good idea to call a customer service number to ensure your request has been received. Canceling in Person Find the receipt or confirmation code for your purchase.  Go to the nearest location where you want to cancel an order. This method is often used when you have selected a “ship to store” option. Find the Customer Service help desk. Give the representative your order number and receipt and tell them you want to cancel. Give them your credit card to credit the purchase.  Opt to return the item if it has already shipped and they won’t accept the cancellation. You may be required to pay shipping to all delivered items. Get a cancellation number or a new receipt to confirm you have cancelled successfully.

If you made the order by phone, you may have written down a confirmation code in place of the receipt.
Call the company’s customer service hotline.
Find it on the receipt or on the “Contact Us” section of their website.
Look for the customer service number using an online tool, like GetHuman.
They list all major retailers and provide numbers for them.
You can also use their calling service to call the company.
Dial the number from a touch-tone phone.
Use the numbers or the voice menus to go to the order cancellation section, or simply the order section of the menu.
Follow the prompts to reach a customer service representative.
Tell them your confirmation code and any other pertinent information.
If the prompts don’t lead you to an order information section, dial zero to be put on the line with an operator or customer service representative more quickly.
Listen for instructions about whether the order can be cancelled.
If the order has already shipped, the customer service rep will tell you to refuse the package at the door or to return it using their returns process.
Ask for a confirmation code if your cancellation is accepted.
Write it somewhere where you will remember to look later.
Watch your credit card or bank account to see signs of the funds being returned.
If they don’t return your purchase price within one month, contact the customer service number with your confirmation code to insist on a refund.
Canceling Online Sign into your online account on the website where you ordered the item.
Try to do this as soon as possible, since online shipments usually go out fast.
If the item has already shipped, you may not be able to cancel it.
Go to the “My Orders” section of the website once you’ve signed in.
Find the order that you want to cancel in the list of orders.
Look for a “Cancel Order” link or button.
Press it.
If there isn’t a button that says this, look for customer service contact information.
Some companies prefer that you cancel orders by phone or through email.
Fill out any information regarding why you want to cancel the order.
Submit your cancellation.
Alternatively, use the email address provided to cancel the order.

If you are submitting a cancellation request by email, make sure to include your name, the order date, the order number, an account number, your address, item descriptions and the reason for your return in your email.
Wait to hear back about your cancellation on your account or by email.
If you don’t hear anything within one or two business days, it is a good idea to call a customer service number to ensure your request has been received.
Canceling in Person Find the receipt or confirmation code for your purchase.
Go to the nearest location where you want to cancel an order.
This method is often used when you have selected a “ship to store” option.
Find the Customer Service help desk.
Give the representative your order number and receipt and tell them you want to cancel.
Give them your credit card to credit the purchase.
Opt to return the item if it has already shipped and they won’t accept the cancellation.
You may be required to pay shipping to all delivered items.
Get a cancellation number or a new receipt to confirm you have cancelled successfully.
